intro: Pseudourceolina robledoana, commonly known as the Robledo's pseudourceolina, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy foliage, which help it adapt to its native habitat. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
